alert.note: Alert for Essex; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 7:48PM EDT until May 03 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Little Falls affecting Essex and Passaic Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River At Little Falls. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, The lower end of East-Holsman Street in Paterson, closest to the river, begins to flood. At 6.0 feet, Portions of Hoffman Grove in Wayne sustain some nuisance flooding. At 6.5 feet, Low lying areas in the vicinity of Two Bridges in Wayne are flooded. The lower end of Bergen Street in Paterson, closest to the river, begins to flood. At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding begins in Lincoln Park, Wayne and Little Falls. At 8.0 feet, Flooding occurs in the "Old" Wayne area of Wayne. The recycling center and Wagaraw Road ball field complex in Hawthorne begins to experience flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EDT Wednesday was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.2 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.1 feet on 10/10/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Passaic River Little Falls 7.0 7.1 Wed 7 pm 6.2 5.6 Crested &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM EDT.
